titles.title: Condemning the terrorist attack in Jakarta, Indonesia, that occurred on September 9, 2004.
Condemning the terrorist attack in Jakarta, Indonesia, that occurred on September 9, 2004.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on International Relations.
Mr. McHugh moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H. Res. 767.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: States that the House of Representatives: (1) condemns in the strongest terms the terrorist attack in Jakarta, Indonesia, that occurred on September 9, 2004; (2) expresses its deepest condolences to the families of the victims and conveys its hope for the recovery of the injured; and (3) urges the United States, Indonesia, Australia, and all other countries to stand united against terrorism and to work together to bring to justice the perpetrators of the Jakarta terrorist attack.
